nodes.label: C3 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: A photosynthetic pathway where Rubisco directly fixes CO2 in mesophyll cells, often limited by Rubisco capacity, RuBP regeneration, and Pi regeneration.

nodes.label: C4 Photosynthesis
nodes.description: A photosynthetic pathway with spatial separation of CO2 fixation, enhancing efficiency at higher temperatures and often less limited by Rubisco at optimal temperatures.

nodes.label: Temperature Response of Photosynthesis
nodes.description: The varying efficiency and limitation factors of photosynthesis across a range of non-harmful temperatures.

nodes.label: Rubisco Capacity
nodes.description: The maximum rate at which the enzyme Rubisco can fix CO2, a primary photosynthetic limitation in C3 plants at low CO2 and in C4 plants below 20°C.

nodes.label: RuBP Regeneration
nodes.description: The process of regenerating ribulose-1,5-bisphosphate, a substrate for Rubisco in the Calvin cycle, identified as a limitation in C3 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Pi Regeneration
nodes.description: The regeneration of inorganic phosphate, crucial for ATP synthesis and Calvin cycle function, becomes a limitation in C3 plants at higher temperatures.

nodes.label: Rubisco Activase Stability
nodes.description: The resilience of Rubisco activase to maintain function; its heat-induced lability limits C3 photosynthesis at elevated temperatures and is a future constraint.

nodes.label: Electron Transport Capacity
nodes.description: The maximum rate of electron flow through the photosynthetic electron transport chain, a limitation at higher temperatures in C3 plants and an expected future constraint.

nodes.label: Low CO2 Conditions
nodes.description: Environmental state where CO2 concentration is low, making Rubisco capacity the dominant limitation for C3 photosynthesis.

nodes.label: Elevated Temperatures
nodes.description: Temperatures higher than optimal, leading to shifted photosynthetic limitations towards Pi regeneration, electron transport, and Rubisco activase lability.

nodes.label: Thermal Optimum for Photosynthesis
nodes.description: The temperature at which photosynthetic rates are maximal; it can shift with growth conditions and acclimation.

nodes.label: Acclimation to Temperature
nodes.description: Physiological adjustments by plants to sustained temperature changes, enhancing components like Pi regeneration, electron transport, and Rubisco activase stability.

nodes.label: Global Climate Change
nodes.description: Anticipated global warming and increased CO2 levels, expected to shift photosynthetic limitations towards electron transport and Rubisco activase constraints.

nodes.label: High CO2 Conditions
nodes.description: Environmental state with elevated CO2 concentrations, predicted under global change to increase the prominence of electron transport and Rubisco activase limitations.

nodes.label: Plant Productivity
nodes.description: The overall efficiency of biomass production by plants, directly influenced by photosynthetic performance under various conditions.

nodes.label: Cold-Adapted Plants
nodes.description: Plant species thriving in cold environments, typically with a safe photosynthetic operating range of 0–30°C.

nodes.label: Warm-Season Crops
nodes.description: Agricultural plants that grow optimally in warmer conditions, with a safe photosynthetic operating range of 7–40°C.

nodes.label: Tropical/Desert Species
nodes.description: Plant species adapted to hot, often arid or humid tropical environments, with a safe photosynthetic operating range of 15–45°C.

nodes.label: Chilling-Tolerant C4 Species
nodes.description: C4 plant varieties that can maintain photosynthetic function and avoid Rubisco limitation at temperatures below 20°C.

nodes.label: C4 Cycle Enzymes
nodes.description: Key enzymes of the C4 photosynthetic pathway, such as PEPC, which are increased during acclimation to cooler conditions in C4 plants.

is primary limitation for (at low CO2, various temps)
